results.title: Rediscovered harmonies
results.creator_credit: Sofidoc S A and Lucien Peroisy
results.brief_description: The origin of different musical instruments. The Music Instrumental du Conservatoire de Brussels has a large collection of instruments some dating from prehistoric times. The film uses this collection to present an insight into the origin of musical instruments and describes the development from the Middle Ages to the present.

results.title: Redex round Australia car trials: 1953, 1954, 1955
results.creator_credit: Sally Jackson and Screen Sound Australia
results.brief_description: Screen Sound Australia uses newsreels and home movie footage, photographs, newspapers and interviews to present a detailed account of the world famous Redex trials held in Australia between 1953 and 1955. Over a distance of 6,500 miles, competitors drove standard passenger vehicles on a designated route around the eastern half of Australia. Rather than being a race, competitors were required to complete every segment in a fixed time, losing points if they arrived at any destination a minute early or late. We see the thrills and spills of the races as well as the cunning and ingenuity of the drivers who maneuvered their cars along dusty and hazardous outback routes where there was no access to motels, petrol stations, or even roads.

results.title: Red, white and blues = Red, white & blues
results.creator_credit: Mike Figgis, Alex Gibney, Margaret Bodde, Reverse Angle International and Vulcan (US)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Blues Collection = Martin Scorsese presents The Blues a musical journey [DVD]”.
Part of Martin Scorsese’s “The Blues Collection”, “Red, White & Blues” is directed by Mike Figgis with is his take on the influence of American blues music on musicians in the United Kingdom. A jam session recorded live in the studios at Abbey Road 2002 with some of the big names from the UK - Tom Jones, Jeff Beck, Lulu, and Van Morrison (to name a few) - provides an anchor point for the film and in between songs recorded at the session are interviews and music clips which make up this documentary. From the post-war years and a tradition of folk music and ‘skiffle’, the blues found a new audience and enthusiasts for the form flourished. Nightclubs featuring rhythm and blues bands became abundant; vinyl records were shared amongst friends and fellow musicians, spreading the blues influence until it exploded in the 1960s. Bands from the UK (such as The Rolling Stones and Cream) toured in America during this period whereupon names like Muddy Waters and B.B. King became household names in what otherwise may have been a lost art form in mainstream America. Some of the performers featured/interviewed include Booker T & the MGs, Big Bill Broonzy, Georgie Fame, Lonnie Donegan, The Beatles, Sister Rosetta Tharpe, Alexis Korner, John Mayall, Eric Clapton, Eric Burdon and Mick Fleetwood.

results.title: Red Sunday: the story of the Battle of Little Big Horn
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, Robert A. Henkel, James R. Graff and James B. Kelly
results.brief_description: A study of the Battle of Little Big Horn which weaves a wealth of original drawings (mostly done by Indian who were participants of the actual battle), photographs and paintings, both by Indian and white artists with recreated live cavalry action on the site itself. Narrated by John McIntire. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Red stone dancer: Henri Gaudier Brzeska
results.brief_description: A study of one of Gaudier-Brzeska’s most important sculptures, seen in different aspects of movement and light. The structure of the film is based on the characteristics found in a roll of film offcuts: random rhythms, interrupted movements, repeated movements, and the image relationships created by those movements and the static shots. Electronic sound track devised by Arthur Cantrill.

results.title: Red poll
results.brief_description: The Red Poll breed of cattle, which originated in East Anglia, England, is enjoying an increasing popularity throughout the world. It is a dual-purpose breed, providing milk and beef combined. The film explains to farmers the breed’s main characteristics and its advantages.

results.title: Red light in full flight
results.creator_credit: Sharyn Prentice, Samia Mikhail and Flamingo Star Films
results.brief_description: The culture of Middle eastern belly dancing in Australia is a prolific one, with belly dancers in Australia outnumbering dancers in other countries. The director gleans anecdotes about the history of this sensual womens’ dance and interviews Australian dancers about their dance, their lives and their culture. It also discusses the importance of traditional cultural dance in women’s lives.

results.title: Red firecracker, green firecracker [DVD] = Pao da shuang deng
results.creator_credit: Yung and Associates, Chan Chun-Keung, Yung Naiming and He Ping
results.brief_description: Cai Chunzhi’s (Jing Ning) family own a prosperous firecracker factory on the banks of the Yellow River in Northern China. When her father dies, because she is the only child she inherits the factory and becomes “Master”. She dresses like a man and everyone addresses her as “Master” but as a woman, her hold on power is tenuous and she carefully respects the authority of the factory head, Man Dihong. When she hires an artist to paint door gods for the Chinese New Year her life is turned upside down. Niu Bao is a handsome young painter whose pride and headstrong nature put him on a collision course with Dihong, as Bao and his ‘master’ struggle with their attraction to each other. Winner of 3 Golden Rooster Awards (the Chinese equivalent of the Oscars). Based on the novel by Feng Jicai.

results.title: Red ensign
results.creator_credit: Jerome Jackson, Gaumont-British Instructional and Michael Powell
results.brief_description: This is the story of David Barr, a shipbuilder, who fights to keep the shipyards open during the Depression of the 1930’s. David Barr fights the cautious businessman, Lord Dean, both for the affection of the heiress, June MacKinnon, and for the use of her money to finance his construction program. Stars Leslie Banks, Carol Goodner, Alfred Drayton, Frank Vosper.

results.title: Red ball express
results.brief_description: To the music of “Orange Blossom Special” a train changes shape and colour. The impressionistic animation is drawn directly onto the film. Music played by Cecil Creasey.
